title: Bunker Hill, 1956
creator_credit: Kent Mackenzie, Merl Edelman and University of Southern California
brief_description: A study of the people who live in the downtown section of Los Angeles called Bunker Hill. Presents a typical day in their lives and the problems they must face when uprooted by the razing of the section for building offices. Uses recorded voices of the residents. Makes a plea for the preservation of Bunker Hill.
